intro: Acridocarpus vanderystii, commonly known as Vanderyst's acridocarp, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants known for their toxic sap and aromatic properties. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
